qas.question: Golconda is a type of what kind of painting?
In what century did Golconda painting develop?
What type of colors would one generally find in Golconda painting?
In what century did Hyderabad style painting develop?
What types of scenes does Hyderabad style painting generally contain?

answers.text: regional landscape, culture, costumes and jewellery

context: The region is well known for its Golconda and Hyderabad painting styles which are branches of <a0_0>Deccani painting<a0_0/>. Developed during the <a1_0>16th century<a1_0/>, the Golconda style is a native style blending foreign techniques and bears some similarity to the Vijayanagara paintings of neighbouring Mysore. A significant use of <a2_0>luminous gold and white<a2_0/> colours is generally found in the Golconda style. The Hyderabad style originated in the <a3_0>17th century<a3_0/> under the Nizams. Highly influenced by Mughal painting, this style makes use of bright colours and mostly depicts <a4_0>regional landscape, culture, costumes and jewellery<a4_0/>.
